title: Bug 19089: Missing Popup Menu in Java Editor Ruler (Photon)
description: The bug report indicates an issue with the Java editor ruler in the Photon version, where the expected popup menu is not appearing as intended.
OB:
When performing the following actions in the Java editor:
1) Open a Java editor.
2) Right-click on the left vertical ruler,
the expected behavior is that a popup menu should appear, providing options to add breakpoints, marks, and other relevant functionalities. However, in the reported case, this expected popup menu is not displaying.
EB: The expected behavior is that in the Photon version, when a Java editor is open, right-clicking on the left vertical ruler should trigger a popup menu. This menu should offer options to add breakpoints, marks, and other relevant features. However, the bug report indicates that this popup menu is not appearing as expected.
SR:
To reproduce the issue in the Photon version:
1) Open a Java editor.
2) Right-click on the left vertical ruler. The expected outcome is that a popup menu will appear, allowing you to add breakpoints, marks, and other relevant items. However, in this version, the popup menu is missing.
